title: How to Make a Floppy Disk Clock

steps.headline: Disassemble the clock, you will only need the mechanism.
Drill a hole on the center of the floppy disk.
Press the mechanism against the floppy disk.
align the other floppy disk with the clock.
steps.description: This will serve as the base.

steps.headline: Obtain a zip tie and insert it on the hole of the disk.
steps.description:
This will combine the 2 floppy disk together. The clock now has a base and can stand. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/67\/Make-a-Floppy-Disk-Clock-Step-10Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Floppy-Disk-Clock-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/67\/Make-a-Floppy-Disk-Clock-Step-10Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Floppy-Disk-Clock-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Insert a battery and you now have a working clock with a retro design!.

text:
Gather 2 floppy disk. Remove any labels or stickers. Wipe it clean. Obtain a cheap clock. Disassemble the clock, you will only need the mechanism. Drill a hole on the center of the floppy disk. Hot glue the clock mechanism. Press the mechanism against the floppy disk. Allow to dry. align the other floppy disk with the clock. This will serve as the base. Obtain a zip tie and insert it on the hole of the disk. This will combine the 2 floppy disk together. The clock now has a base and can stand. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/67\/Make-a-Floppy-Disk-Clock-Step-10Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Floppy-Disk-Clock-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/67\/Make-a-Floppy-Disk-Clock-Step-10Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Floppy-Disk-Clock-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Install the clock's hands. Insert a battery and you now have a working clock with a retro design!.
